sen.j: 東坊城家（ひがしぼうじょうけ）は、五条長経（正二位・参議・刑部省、1242年 - 1315年）の次男東坊城茂長（位階・参議・治部省、1284年 - 1343年）を祖とする堂上家である。
sen.e: The house of Higashibojo, one of the houses of Dojo, was established by Shigenaga HIGASHIBOJO (Court Rank, Councillor, Department of Etiquette and Ceremonies, 1284-1343) who was the second son of Nagatsune GOJO (Senior Second Court Rank, Councillor, Department of Justice, 1242-1315).

The house of Higashibojo, one of the houses of Dojo, was established by Shigenaga HIGASHIBOJO (Court Rank, Councillor, Department of Etiquette and Ceremonies, 1284-1343) who was the second son of Nagatsune GOJO (Senior Second Rank, Councillor, Department of Justice, 1242-1315).
sen.cmt: Changed "Senior Second Court Rank" to "Senior Second Rank" in line with word list of July 31st.
sen.e: The Higashibojo Family, one of the houses of Dojo, was established by Shigenaga HIGASHIBOJO (Court Rank, Councillor, Department of Etiquette and Ceremonies, 1284-1343) who was the second son of Nagatsune GOJO (Senior Second Rank, Councillor, Department of Justice, 1242-1315).
sen.cmt: "House of ～" -> "～Family" に変更しました。

sen.j: 家格は、半家 (公家)である。
sen.e: The family was ranked as "Hanke," a type of family status of the Court nobles.
The family was ranked as "Hanke," a type of family status in the Court nobility
sen.cmt: Changed "court nobility" to "court nobles".
sen.e: The family was ranked as "Hanke," a type of family status in the Court nobility
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 極官は室町時代の東坊城益長（1407年 - 1474年）以降、代々文章博士・日本の官制・少納言・大蔵省等を経て権大納言を極官とする。
sen.e: The family served as Professor of Literature, Director of the Bureau of Education, Assistant Councilor of State, and Director of Department of Treasury after the time of Masunaga HIGASHIBOJO (1407-1474) in the Muromachi period, and the top rank the family could attain was the Junior Chief Councillor of State.
sen.cmt: 「代々文章博士・日本の官制・少納言・大蔵省を経て」とありますが意味がおかしいので、Wikipediaの本文をあたったところ、「日本の官制」は「大学頭」、「大蔵省」は「大蔵卿」とありましたので、そのように訳出しました。
sen.e: The family provided a Professor of Literature, Directors of the Bureau of Education, an Assistant Councilor of State, and a Director of Department of Treasury from the era of Masunaga HIGASHIBOJO (1407-1474) and thereafter in the Muromachi period, the top rank attained being Junior Chief Councillor of State.
sen.cmt: The family itself did not serve in these posts, members of the family did. Hence, I changed "served" to "provided".
sen.e: The family provided a Professor of Literature, Directors of the Bureau of Education, Shonagon (lesser councilor of state), and a Director of Department of Treasury from the era of Masunaga HIGASHIBOJO (1407-1474) and thereafter in the Muromachi period, the top rank attained being Junior Chief Councillor of State.
sen.cmt: "an Assistant Councilor of State" -> "Shonagon (lesser councilor of state)" に変更しました。

sen.j: 家業は紀伝道で、代々天皇の侍読を務めた。
sen.e: The house business was "Kidendo," the study of the histories, and the family served as the Imperial tutor for generations.
The house business was "Kidendo," the study of the histories, and the family provided Imperial tutors for generations.
sen.cmt: The family itself did not serve in these posts, members of the family did. Hence, I changed "served" to "provided".
sen.e: The house business was "Kidendo," the study of the histories, and the family provided Imperial tutors for generations.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 歴代当主の中には漢学の才を認められ、改元の際の新年号の候補およびその出典を記した「年号勘文」の提出者となった者も多い。
sen.e: When the era name was changed, many successive heads of the family, who acquired a reputation for the study of the Chinese classics, became presenters of "Nengo-kanmon," an opinion paper in which possible era names and the source of them were mentioned.

When the era name was changed, many successive heads of the family, who had acquired a reputation for the study of the Chinese classics, became presenters of "Nengo-kanmon," an opinion paper in which possible era names and the source of these names were discussed.
sen.cmt: Adjusted slightly, to make the sentence read better. Changed "who acquired" to "who had acquired" and "mentioned" to "discussed".
sen.e: When the era name was changed, many successive heads of the family, who had acquired a reputation for the study of the Chinese classics, became presenters of "Nengo-kanmon," an opinion paper in which possible era names and the source of these names were discussed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 東坊城家は高辻家から見ると、本来ならば庶流扱いである。
sen.e: Properly speaking, the house of Higashibojo should be treated as an illegitimate lineage from the view point of the house of Takatsuji.
From the viewpoint of the house of Takatsuji, the house of Higashibojo should be treated as an illegitimate lineage.
sen.cmt: I think that "properly speaking" is unnecessary here.
sen.e: From the viewpoint of the Takatsuji family, Higashibojo family should be treated as an illegitimate lineage.
sen.cmt: "house of ～" -> "～family" に変更しました。

sen.j: しかし、東坊城家の女子からは勾当内侍（掌侍（ないしのじょう）の筆頭）を多く輩出し、同家からは氏長者も出した実績がある。
sen.e: However, the house of Higashibojo succeeded in producing a lot of "Naishi no jo" (Chief Court Ladies) from the females of the family, and the head of the family as well.
However, the house of Higashibojo succeeded in providing a lot of "Naishi no jo" (Chief Court Ladies), and heads of the families as well.
sen.cmt: The Chief court ladies are obviously female so "from the females of the family" can be removed.
sen.e: However, the Higashibojo family succeeded in providing many "Naishi no jo" (Chief Court Ladies) and the head of all the Higashibojo families as well.
sen.cmt: スタイル。“a lot of” -> “many”意味が不明瞭のため、 “heads of the families”を修正。"house of ～" -> "～family" に変更しました。

sen.j: 更に、幕末の東坊城聡長（正二位・権大納言、1799年 - 1861年）は武家伝奏に任じられている。
sen.e: Furthermore, Tokinaga HIGASHIBOJO (Senior Second Court Rank, Junior Chief Councillor of State, 1799-1861) was appointed the Imperial official in charge of communication between the shogunate and the court in the closing days of the Tokugawa shogunate.

Furthermore, Tokinaga HIGASHIBOJO (Senior Second Rank, Junior Chief Councillor of State, 1799-1861) was appointed the Imperial official in charge of communication between the shogunate and the court in the closing days of the Tokugawa shogunate.
sen.cmt: Changed "Senior Second Court Rank" to "Senior Second Rank" as per the term list of July 31st
sen.e: Furthermore, Tokinaga HIGASHIBOJO (Senior Second Rank, Junior Chief Councillor of State, 1799-1861) was appointed the Imperial official in charge of communication between the shogunate and the court in the closing days of the Tokugawa shogunate.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その実績もあって、江戸時代の家禄は菅原氏出身の堂上家では最高の300石であった。
sen.e: Because of such performance, the hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 300 koku, the best among the houses of Dojo descended from the Sugawara clan.
Partly because of this record, the hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 300 koku, the best among the houses of Dojo descended from the Sugawara clan.
sen.cmt: Changed "such a performance" to "this record".
sen.e: Partly because of this record, the hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 300 koku, the best among the houses of Dojo descended from the Sugawara clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.cmt: "明治以降" seems to me to include the Meiji period.

sen.j: 明治時代以降は子爵の爵位を与えられた。
sen.e: The family was given the title of viscount after the Meiji period.
From the Meiji period onwards, the family held the title of viscount.
sen.cmt: Changed to more natural English.
sen.e: From the Meiji period onwards, the family held the title of viscount.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 大学頭東坊城任長の子、位階勲等子爵、貴族院議員東坊城徳長は、20歳にして製作会社「入江ぷろだくしょん」を設立した戦前の映画女優入江たか子（出生名東坊城英子、長女）、戦前の日活撮影所等で活躍した映画俳優・脚本家・映画監督の東坊城恭長（三男）兄妹の父、
sen.e: Yoshinaga HIGASHIBOJO, a son of Tadanaga HIGASHIBOJO of the Director of the Bureau of Education, the Viscount, and a member of the House of Lords, was a father of Takako IRIE (born Hideko HIGASHIBOJO, the eldest daughter) who was a prewar movie actress establishing a production company "Irie Production" at the age of 20, and her brother, Yasunaga HIGASHIBOJO (the third son) who was a movie actor, a scriptwriter, and a movie director working actively for the Nikkatsu Studio in the prewar period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshinaga HIGASHIBOJO, a son of Tadanaga HIGASHIBOJO who was the Director of the Bureau of Education, a Viscount, and a member of the House of Lords, had a daughter, Takako IRIE (born Hideko HIGASHIBOJO, the eldest daughter) who was a prewar movie actress establishing a production company "Irie Production" at the age of 20, and a son, Yasunaga HIGASHIBOJO (the third son) who was a movie actor, a scriptwriter, and a movie director working actively for the Nikkatsu Studio in the prewar period.
sen.cmt: Changed "was a father of" to "had a daughter/son" for more natural English.
sen.e: Yoshinaga HIGASHIBOJO, a son of Tadanaga HIGASHIBOJO who was the Director of the Bureau of Education, a Viscount, and a member of the House of Lords, had a daughter, Takako IRIE (born Hideko HIGASHIBOJO, the eldest daughter) who was a prewar movie actress establishing a production company "Irie Production" at the age of 20, and a son, Yasunaga HIGASHIBOJO (the third son) who was a movie actor, a scriptwriter, and a movie director working actively for the Nikkatsu Studio in the prewar period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 入江の長女で、東映京都撮影所作品、のちに大林宣彦作品で知られる女優入江若葉（出生名田村若葉、父は元俳優田村道美）の祖父に当たる。
sen.e: He was also a grandfather of IRIE's eldest daughter, Wakaba IRIE (born Wakaba TAMURA, a daughter of Michiyoshi TAMURA of a former actor), who appeared in the movie produced by the Toei Movie Studios later known as Nobuhiko OBAYASHI's work.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshinaga was also the grandfather of IRIE's eldest daughter, Wakaba IRIE (born Wakaba TAMURA, fathered by Michiyoshi TAMURA a former actor), who became known appearing in movies produced by the Toei Movie Studios and later in work by Nobuhiko OBAYASHI.
sen.cmt: I think the latter half of the source is explaining how IRIE became known, and have reworked the sentence accordingly.
sen.e: Yoshinaga was also the grandfather of IRIE's eldest daughter, Wakaba IRIE (born Wakaba TAMURA, fathered by Michiyoshi TAMURA a former actor), who became known appearing in movies produced by the Toei Movie Studios and later in work by Nobuhiko OBAYASHI..
sen.cmt: スペース削除。ピリオド。

sen.j: 徳長は1911年に引退し爵位を長子東坊城政長が継いだが、1922年徳長の没後、翌1923年の関東大震災によって東京の家屋敷は半壊、東坊城家はそれを手放す憂き目に遭った。
sen.e: Yoshinaga retired in 1911, and his eldest son, Masanaga HIGASHIBOJO, succeeded to the title and the court rank, but after Yoshinaga's death in 1922, the family's residence in Tokyo was half-destroyed due to the Great Kanto Earthquake of 1923; thus, the house of Higashibojo was unfortunate to relinquish its estate.

Yoshinaga retired in 1911, and his eldest son, Masanaga HIGASHIBOJO, succeeded to the title and the court rank, but in 1923 a year after Yoshinaga's death in 1922, the family's residence in Tokyo was half-destroyed in the Great Kanto Earthquake of 1923 and the house of Higashibojo found itself in the unfortunate position of having to relinquish its estate.
sen.cmt: Changed to more natural English.
sen.e: Yoshinaga retired in 1911, and his eldest son, Masanaga HIGASHIBOJO, succeeded to the title and the court rank, but in 1923 a year after Yoshinaga's death in 1922, the family's residence in Tokyo was half-destroyed in the Great Kanto Earthquake of 1923 and the Higashibojo family found itself in the unfortunate position of having to relinquish its estate.
sen.cmt: "house of ～" -> "～family" に変更しました。

sen.j: 爵位継承者は、ついで元長であった。
sen.e: The next successor to the title and the court rank was Motonaga.
The next successor to the title and the court rank was Motonaga.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The next successor to the title and the court rank was Motonaga.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同家のもともとの居所は「西院参町」（京都市上京区）、菩提寺（本墓所）は京都・上京区の浄福寺である。
sen.e: The family's residence was originally located in "Nishiin-san-cho" (Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City), and the family temple (the family plot) was the Jofuku-ji Temple.
The family's residence was originally located in "Nishiin-san-cho" (Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City), and the family temple (the family plot) was the Jofuku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The family's residence was originally located in "Nishiin-san-cho" (Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City), and the family temple (the family tomb) was the Jofuku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: “plot” は口語的過ぎ、また意味が不明瞭。→ “tomb”.

sen.j: 戦後、東坊城家名の五輪塔を徳長の長女英子（入江たか子）が1962年に多磨霊園に建立している。
sen.e: In the postwar period, Hideko (Takako IRIE), Yoshinaga's eldest daughter, set up a stupa with the name of Higashibojo in the Tama Cemetery in 1962.
In the postwar period, Hideko (Takako IRIE), Yoshinaga's eldest daughter, set up a stupa with the name of Higashibojo in the Tama Cemetery in 1962.
sen.cmt: Changed "with the name of" to "under the name of"
sen.e: In the postwar period, Hideko (Takako IRIE), Yoshinaga's eldest daughter, set up a stupa with the name of Higashibojo in the Tama Cemetery in 1962.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 女優を引退した英子が1959年に東京・銀座でバーを始めた3年後のことであった。
sen.e: It was three years after Hideko, who quit being an actress, opened a bar in Ginza, Tokyo in 1959.
This was three years after she quit being an actress and opened a bar in Ginza, Tokyo.
sen.cmt: We already have the date from 1962 in the previous sentence.
sen.e: This was three years after she had stopped being an actress and opened a bar in Ginza, Tokyo.
sen.cmt: スタイルと文法ミス。 “quit -> “had stopped”.
